result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Schlough was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Domestic Abuse.  Not to possess any firearms.  Firearm that was seized to be destroyed.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  No contact w/C.H. or her family.  Absolute Sobriety.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant David J. Schlough in court with attorney Misty M. Muter.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim appears by phone.  Victim makes statement.   No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Defendant David J. Schlough not in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to quash warrant.  Court orders warrant quashed.
Defendant David J. Schlough appeared by video means with Attorney Middleton. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Defendant David J. Schlough appeared by video means with Attorney Muter. Prosecuting Atty Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Victim by telephone to the court.  State request $100,000 cash bond w/ conditions.  No contact with C.H. or her residence.  Attorney Muter advises of ties to the community.  Defendant is unemployed.  No prior criminal convictions.  State adds.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived. $25,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety at all times.  No contact with C.H. or her residence.  No possess of weapons and all weapons in possession shall be surrendered to law enforcement upon release.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.
